Article Title: Pune Porsche crash case: SC to hear bail plea of boy's father
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Supreme Court on Wednesday agreed to hear the bail plea of the father of the 17-year-old involved in the Porsche car crash in Pune, who is facing prosecution for manipulating the blood sample test of his son by allegedly replacing it with his own blood sample.A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan also issued notice on an appeal filed by another man whose son was sitting in the car when the accident took place and he is facing charges for manipulating blood samples. They moved the SC after their bail plea was rejected by Bombay HC. It also directed them to furnish their petition to advocate Manan Verma who was representing the deceased family. The accident took place at around 2.30 am on May 19, 2024, when a Porsche car, allegedly driven by a juvenile in an inebriated state, rammed into a motorcycle in Pune's Kalyani Nagar area. The crash killed 24-year-old software engineers, Aneesh Awadhiya and Ashwini Koshta.
Article Summary: Supreme Court agrees to hear the bail plea of the father of the 17-year-old involved in the Porsche car crash in Pune. He is facing prosecution for manipulating the blood sample test of his son by allegedly replacing it with his own blood sample.

Article Title: ‘It's not baigan’: TMC mocks sports minister Mandaviya over Mohun Bagan faux pas — video
Article Text:
Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya (ANI photo/File)

NEW DELHI: The ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) in poll-bound West Bengal mocked Union sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya after he mispronounced the name of Kolkata-based football club Mohun Bagan during a press conference.In the clip, Mandaviya was seen struggling to pronounce “Mohun Bagan” correctly, eventually uttering a word that sounded like “baigan”, the Hindi term for eggplant. The mispronunciation quickly became the subject of online trolling.West Bengal’s ruling party, the Trinamool Congress (TMC), on Wednesday also reacted to the clip, using it to mock the Union minister and point out the error in his pronunciation."The Union Sports Minister has, once again, revealed the deep-seated contempt the BJP harbours towards Bengal. He mangled the names of our most revered football institutions, referring to the legendary Mohun Bagan as "Mohan baigan" and the iconic East Bengal as "East baigan".The party further wrote: "For Bengalis, Mohun Bagan and East Bengal are symbols of identity and pride. We have lived and breathed this beautiful game for over a century, celebrating victories with the same fervor as festivals and mourning defeats as personal loss."Accusing the rival BJP of viewing Bengal through the "lens of Bangla-Birodhi arrogance", the TMC claimed that for the saffron party, anything associated with Bengal "merits only mockery and dismissal.""Yet, those who view Bengal through the lens of Bangla-Birodhi arrogance cannot even extend the basic courtesy of pronouncing these sacred names correctly. Why would they? In their eyes, anything associated with Bengal merits only mockery and dismissal," the TMC wrote on X.Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that the Indian Super League (ISL) will start from February 14. The minister also noted that all 14 clubs have agreed to play the ISL this season."We have decided that the ISL will start on February 14, Saturday, and all of our clubs will participate in it," Mansukh Mandaviya told the reporters."In the country, football has progressed. In football, the country performs well. Through the League, the country gets good players. With this aim, the ISL league will be held," he added.
Article Summary: Mansukh Mandaviya mispronounced the name of Kolkata-based football club Mohun Bagan during a press conference. West Bengal's ruling party, the Trinamool Congress (TMC), used the clip to mock the Union minister and point out the error in his pronunciation.

Article Title: Unable to move, hippo stuck in Kolkata zoo pool for 2 weeks
Article Text: KOLKATA: A hippopotamus at Alipore zoo, unable to move probably because of a neurological disease or a leg injury, has stayed put in a pool of water in its enclosure for the past fortnight and refused to leave even in the evening for its night sheltera sharp departure from its normal routine.Zoo authorities have set up a five-member medical team to monitor the three-and-a-half-year-old resident — named Hippo One — 24x7 and are in touch with other zoos to decide on the course of treatment. For now, the hippo enclosure has been cordoned off with “view-cutters”.Zoo officials said there were some signs of improvement in the condition of the male hippo, which was brought from Odisha’s Nandankanan Zoological Park in Sept 2024. The animal has slowly started eating its normal diet — a mix of sweet potato, carrot, green grass banana, and sugarcane top.“It is slowly responding to treatment, but we are yet to arrive at a definitive diagnosis,” zoo director Tripti Sah said. “At this stage, we cannot say with certainty what it is suffering from — a neurological ailment or a leg injury. Three doctors from the zoo and two from a veterinary hospital in Belgachhia are treating itThe team is continuously monitoring its condition...We are, however, hopeful about recovery. ”Sah said. Officials have decided against forcibly moving the close to two-tonne hippo out of the water.The young male was brought to the Alipore address with a female companionfrom Nandankanan, who The female died within days of arrival. The cause of her death remains unknown. The zoo now houses another hippopotamus — a 22-year-old female — in an adjacent enclosure. SSources said following the female’s deaththis, Hippo One had become less active and showed signs of depressionand loss of appetite. By the second half of 2025, it gradually regained mobility and resumed eating normally.
Article Summary: Zoo authorities have set up a five-member medical team to monitor the three-and- a-half-year-old resident — named Hippo One — 24x7. Officials have decided against forcibly moving the close to two-tonne hippo out of the water.

The Los Angeles Dodgers are being closely linked to Bo Bichette as free agency approaches. People around the league believe the Dodgers are willing to wait. The idea is simple: let the market settle, then step in with an offer that favors a shorter term and a higher yearly salary.Toronto’s chances of keeping Bichette appear to be shrinking. While a return is still possible, there is growing belief that Los Angeles sees an opening. The Los Angeles Dodgers have payroll flexibility, a clear plan, and a roster built to win now. That combination makes them a serious threat if Bichette reaches the open market without a deal in place.Most projections place Bo Bichette’s value between seven and eight years, with a total price of $200–210 million. That comes out to roughly $26 million per season. The Los Angeles Dodgers are not known for committing to long contracts unless the fit is perfect. Instead, they often prefer shorter deals that keep future options open.A four- or five-year contract with a higher annual value fits their pattern. There has been little noise about trade talks, which points to this being a free-agent play. Bichette has also indicated he is open to playing second base.That matters because Mookie Betts is expected to remain the Dodgers’ shortstop in 2026. One possible structure discussed around the league is an eight-year, $200 million deal with a fourth-year opt-out and front-loaded money to limit long-term risk.For the Los Angeles Dodgers, Bichette adds a right-handed bat to a lineup already built around Shohei Ohtani and Freddie Freeman. His ability to hit for average and drive in runs strengthens the middle of the order during another title push.For Bichette, a move would mean leaving a team in transition with the Toronto Blue Jays and joining a consistent contender. He would hit with protection and play meaningful games deep into October. Toronto, if he leaves after rejecting a qualifying offer, would receive draft pick compensation and free up money to focus on younger players.Bichette is 27 years old, born March 5, 1998. Over 748 career games, he owns a .294/.342/.462 slash line with 111 home runs. In 2025, he hit .311, one of the best averages in the American League.Defense remains the concern. His metrics at shortstop have been negative throughout his career, including continued struggles in 2025. A move to second base helps, but his glove still lowers his overall value.Also read: MLB trade rumors: Toronto Blue Jays on the verge of singning $500 million Chicago Cubs superstar to get much-needed roster upgrade The Dodgers are in a strong position. Bichette fills a clear need without forcing changes elsewhere, and his bat raises the ceiling of an already elite lineup. Toronto may gain future assets, but Los Angeles gains a player who fits their timeline and their approach to winning now.
Article Summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers are being closely linked to Bo Bichette as free agency approaches. The Dodgers have payroll flexibility, a clear plan, and a roster built to win now. Toronto may gain future assets, but Los Angeles gains a player who fits their timeline and approach to winning now.

Article Title: LeBron James’ astonishing basketball IQ gets stamp of approval from ex-Cavaliers teammate: "That’s not normal"
Article Text:
LeBron James. Image via: John McCoy/ Getty Images

Kevin Love showers praise for LeBron James' basketball IQ



Kevin Love Talks LeBron & Kyrie, the Importance of NBA Vets, and More

Kevin Love on LeBron James as a lifelong student of the game







Kevin Love spent four defining seasons alongside LeBron James in Cleveland, sharing locker rooms, practices, playoff pressure, and, of course, wins. Those years gave Love a front-row seat to habits few teammates ever see. Long after their championship run, Love still speaks about what separated James from everyone else he played with.Love revisited his experiences during a recent appearance on The Old Man and the Three podcast. When he was asked to name the smartest player of his career, he answered LeBron’s name without hesitation.Kevin Love explained that James treated every moment as a learning window. “In shootaround or even out there on the floor, he could do every team’s scout. He knew every team’s play, he knew every guy’s tendency. He watched endless amounts of basketball… It’s a true gift,” Love said at the 23:50 mark. “In terms of basketball, he does have a photographic type memory. That’s not normal… It’s a hack when the best player in the world, a 6’9” 260 LB freight train, is setting the tone in that way. ”James’ basketball strategies helped Cleveland’s run to four straight NBA Finals from 2015 to 2018.Love and James helped deliver the franchise’s first championship in 2016, a title built on trust and execution. Love averaged 15.7 points and 9.2 rebounds across 489 games with the Cavaliers, earning two All-Star selections during that span.James’ awareness often extended beyond his own team. Opponents have recalled moments when he called out their sets before plays unfolded. Love pointed to press conferences where James could recount long sequences with precision, down to positioning and game context, reinforcing how deeply he processed the sport.Their partnership was not without strain. A 2015 tweet from James addressed team accountability and later became a public talking point. Love has since acknowledged the moment stung. The bond between the duo also shines till date. James attended Love’s wedding in 2022, and they often share moments off the court.Today, both players are with different teams. James still performs at a high level with the Los Angeles Lakers at age 41. Love contributes veteran leadership and shooting with the Utah Jazz. However, Love’s view of his former teammate is still the same.Also Read: Los Angeles Lakers head coach JJ Redick comments on coaching LeBron James: "Sometimes he tells me to F off...and he's right"
Article Summary: Kevin Love spent four seasons with LeBron James in Cleveland. Love said James' basketball IQ separated him from everyone else he played with. James' awareness often extended beyond his own team. Love and James helped deliver the franchise’s first championship in 2016.

Article Title: Sydney Warner welcomes baby girl Bella Nicole as 49ers star Fred Warner celebrates becoming a 'family of four'
Article Text:
Fred Warner and wife Sydney announce birth of baby daughter Bella Nicole (Instagram)

Sydney Warner welcomes baby girl and shares intimate family moments







Sydney Warner welcomes baby girl and begins a new chapter that blends quiet faith, family rhythm, and a moment of pause from the roar of football life. The announcement arrived without a date or drama, just warmth and certainty. A household that already knew joy with son Beau now opens its arms to Bella Nicole, a name that feels both tender and grounded.The first images told the story better than any headline. Hospital hallways. Soft light. A blue “Big Brother” hat perched proudly on Beau’s head. Fred Warner’s smile said everything, even as his season waits in uncertainty. The couple let the moment breathe, offering gratitude and calm instead of spectacle. In a world that moves fast, they chose stillness.The parents shared the news with a simple caption that carried weight and faith. “Thankful for God’s protection, strength, and the countless prayers that carried us through her early days,” the message read. “We are finally home and family of four!✨.” The words felt earned, not polished. They spoke to long nights, steady hope, and the relief that comes only after worry passes.Sydney’s photos followed a gentle arc. There were quiet shots before labor, Fred holding Beau close, and the first cuddles with Bella Nicole. A bassinet framed by pink florals. A monogram stitched with care. One image captured Fred beside the hospital bed, another showed him walking the halls as Bella rested. Sydney also shared a moment many new mothers recognize, matching pajamas with her daughter and the honest note, “will never forget these walks back and forth every 3 hours to feed my girl. ”The journey had unfolded in pieces over the past year. In September 2025, Sydney revealed her pregnancy during a picnic scene with ultrasound photos and Beau nearby. “Baby Warner #2 coming 2026,” she wrote, later adding, “Living the best days of our lives.” By December, her tone softened further. “Life has been moving slow lately ♥️ and I love it. Soaking it all up before a new member joins the fam.” Fred answered with joy. “My babiessssss!!❤️❤️❤️”.While Fred rehabs from a severe ankle injury suffered in October, football fades to the background. Playoff hopes remain uncertain, but celebration does not. For now, the Warner home centers on feedings, first breaths, and the grace of arriving safely.Also Read: Rashee Rice accused of years-long domestic abuse as ex-girlfriend’s allegations spark fresh controversy around NFL star

The couple let the moment breathe, offering gratitude and calm instead of spectacle. While Fred rehabs from a severe ankle injury, football fades to the background.

Article Title: MLB trade rumours: Cody Bellinger seeks six- or seven-year contract while New York Yankees prefer shorter commitment
Article Text:
(Image Source - Getty Images)

Cody Bellinger and the New York Yankees exchange multiple offers

Cody Bellinger enters his age-30 season with most teams projecting a five- or six-year deal

Interest from other teams for Cody Bellinger





The New York Yankees are in talks with free agent outfielder Cody Bellinger during the 2025-2026 offseason, and the length of the contract is a major sticking point. It seems like they’re not close to a deal yet, but discussions are still ongoing. Bellinger and his agents at the Boras Corporation are probably aiming for a six- or seven-year contract.In a different segment on MLB Network, Jon Morosi mentioned that Bellinger is still looking for a deal around seven years, while the Yankees, as expected, are leaning towards a four- or five-year agreement. This deadlock comes as reports indicate that the Yankees have made at least two formal offers to Bellinger. General manager Brian Cashman has openly shown the team's desire to bring him back.Talks between Bellinger and the Yankees have moved forward with several offers on the table, but they still can’t agree on the contract length. Brendan Kuty mentioned in The Athletic that the length of the contract might be a sticking point, as Bellinger is looking for a deal of six or seven years. Jon Morosi also chimed in on MLB Network's Hot Stove, stating, "I still in the long-run think Bellinger ends up a Yankee," while noting the back-and-forth discussions.Steve Phillips, also on MLB Network, reacted to the second offer by stating, “There's some back-and-forth which is a good sign for the Yankees... I still in the long-run think Bellinger ends up a Yankee.” Bryan Hoch, via SNYtv, reported, "What I'm told is that there is a gap and it's years and AAV,” referring to average annual value as factors holding up the deal.Robert Murray mentioned that the Yankees and Bellinger aren't really close to making a deal, but New York is still the top contender to sign him. Jon Heyman talked about Bellinger's situation and other Yankees-related topics during a chat on Michael Kay's show that was shared on X.External forecasts give insight into the anticipated duration and worth of the deal. MLB Trade Rumors estimated that Bellinger would land a five-year, $140MM contract at the beginning of the offseason. Most predictions indicate a five- or six-year agreement, as Bellinger approaches his 30th birthday.There’s a history of players landing contracts of seven years or more at that age, but the last free agent hitter to achieve this was Brandon Nimmo in 2022. Since then, no free agent bat in his 30s has signed a six-year deal, although Alex Bregman turned down a six-year proposal from the Tigers last winter when he was a year older.Bobby Milone on X noted, "Boras wants 7 years" is correct (no one giving him that). I heard 30-32m was the max (Doubt anyone giving more). So 5/150-160m is the sweet spot and the Yankees are not there (Cause I doubt any other team is bidding)."Roman Savino replied on X, "I admire Boras for thinking Cody could get 30-32m but last year the Cubs had to pay 5m to be able to trade him. Cody and Boras need to start to be realistic about what his market actually is."Although the Yankees are leading the pack, other teams are also in the mix for Bellinger. The New York Mets have been frequently brought up. There's even talk about a potential reunion with the Cubs.There's a noticeable difference between what Bellinger wants and what teams are offering, with several reports saying he's looking for a deal of six or seven years.Considering the Yankees' offseason, Bellinger's negotiations might be affecting other decisions, like possible trades for starting pitchers such as Freddy Peralta or MacKenzie Gore, as Bobby Milone hinted on X, "The holdup for Peralta or Gore might be Bellinger. As the Brewers and Nationals might want Dominguez or Jones in a deal. If Bellinger gets done, we could see quickly after a trade for a SP."Jack Fungo on X added, "I think they’re pressing to resolve the Bellinger situation first before engaging on the SP market."The Yankees decided to give Trent Grisham a qualifying offer, which changed their compensation pick because of luxury tax rules. This move is linked to their negotiations with Bellinger, but they haven't come to an agreement yet, though talks are still ongoing.Also Read: Who is Reagan Bregman? Everything you need to know about Alex Bregman’s wife
Article Summary: The New York Yankees are in talks with free agent outfielder Cody Bellinger during the 2025-2026 offseason. The length of the contract might be a sticking point, as Bellinger is looking for a deal of six or seven years. Bellinger and his agents are probably aiming for a six- or seven-year contract.

Article Title: “So useless bro”: Chelsea’s devastating defeat against Fulham propelled fans to fume over one star player
Article Text:
Pedro Neto. Image via: CameraSport/ Getty Images

Chelsea's defeat to Fulham sparks backlash toward Pedro Neto



Liam Rosenior’s Chelsea era begins with a devastating loss







Chelsea’s turbulent season took another huge blow at Craven Cottage as a 2–1 defeat to Fulham triggered fury among travelling supporters. Fans shared their frustrations as the match was marred by ill discipline, defensive lapses, and missed chances, which ended with chants aimed at the club’s hierarchy and growing anger toward individual performances.The loss came on a night when Chelsea again struggled to keep control. Marc Cucurella’s first-half red card left the visitors chasing the game. Fulham made their numerical advantage count. While Liam Delap briefly restored hope with his first Premier League goal for the club, the evening ended in frustration. One player, however, became the main focus of fan backlash, and it was none other than Pedro Neto.Pedro Neto found himself at the center of supporters’ anger following another difficult game. The Portuguese winger has endured a challenging run of form. Social media reaction was swift and unforgiving as fans questioned his role in the starting lineup.“Neto is so useless bro,” one supporter wrote on X.Another added, “Garnacho and Estavao should start instead of Neto and Palmer.” The criticism continued to mount as frustrations spilled across timelines. “I don’t understand how Pedro Neto has 0 skill moves, like not one time have I ever seen him skill past a player.I pray Rosenior moves on from him,” another post read.Others took an even harsher tone. “You’re embarrassing. Get Tosin and Neto out of my club,” a fan wrote.Another summed up the mood with, “It’s always gonna be defeat as far as Neto plays in Chelsea. Never seen a winger that can’t beat 1 defender.”On the pitch, Chelsea showed brief resolve. Raul Jimenez had given Fulham the lead early in the second half before Neto’s corner caused chaos in the box, leading to Delap’s equalizer. Harry Wilson’s late winner ensured the frustration lingered long after full-time.The match also served as an unwanted introduction for new head coach Liam Rosenior, who watched from the stands. He inherits a side with one win in nine league matches and a discipline problem that continues to define Chelsea’s campaign.Despite the anger, there remains a sense of transition around the club. Former Chelsea winger Paul Canoville urged unity following Rosenior’s appointment. “Liam Rosenior is a quality coach who knows the game inside out, and that's what matters most,” Canoville said. “So yes, it is a massive moment for the club, for London, for every young person dreaming big. Article Title: 'It's too much': India questioned for not collecting Asia Cup trophy from Mohsin Naqvi
Article Text:
India's captain Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan's captain Salman Agha (AP Photo/Altaf Qadri)

Bangladesh seek T20 WC match shift from India after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit

Willow by Cricbuzz





West Indies all-rounder Jason Holder has weighed in on the India–Pakistan rivalry following the Asia Cup 2025, calling out what he described as excessive on-field theatrics and expressing disappointment over how events unfolded.The Asia Cup once again showcased why clashes between India and Pakistan remain cricket’s most intense rivalry. While the contest has always been charged with emotion and history, the 2025 edition went beyond the 22 yards, with off-field drama capturing almost as much attention as the cricket itself.India lifted the Asia Cup after defeating Pakistan by five wickets in the final, extending their dominance over their arch-rivals in multi-team tournaments. Yet, the post-match scenes drew widespread debate when Indian players chose not to collect the trophy from PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi, amid the backdrop of the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor . Naqvi eventually took the trophy back, resulting in India returning home without the trophy despite their victory.Speaking on thepodcast, Holder was candid about his discomfort with the situation. “I don’t like the India–Pakistan beef. I saw India win the Asia Cup and they didn’t go to accept the trophy. It’s just too much, man,” he said.Holder then broadened the discussion, offering his perspective on how politics and ownership dynamics have influenced franchise cricket. He noted the limited opportunities for Pakistani players in T20 leagues, especially those owned by Indian stakeholders.“Certain Pakistanis can’t be involved in certain teams because they’re owned by Indian owners. It’s just sad, man,” he added.The former West Indies captain stressed the influence top cricketers wield beyond results. “If you’re inspiring a generation and inspiring the world, then we have to find a way to come together,” Holder said. While acknowledging the long political history between the two nations, he believes cricket can still be a starting point for change. “I understand how big this rivalry is off the field,” he noted. “But if change is going to happen, it can start on the cricket field. A way to soften things is by India and Pakistan coming together through sport.”Holder sees potential for sport to influence life beyond cricket. “If it’s possible at a sporting level, maybe it becomes possible in everyday life too,” he said. “Stopping the fighting and tension would be huge.” He also spoke about the cultural impact of athletes as role models: “There’s always a trickle-down effect. When people see their heroes behaving a certain way, it influences them. That’s why it’s sad to see this play out. ”Despite the tensions, Holder emphasised his respect for both nations. “They’re beautiful countries with incredible people and cultures,” he said. “That’s why moments like this hurt everyone who loves cricket.” He concluded with a call to uphold the spirit of the game: “We talk about unity and growing the game. Article Title: UAE weather: Temperatures to drop below 5°c during coldest winter stretch from Jan 10–22
Article Text:

Understanding “Der Al Sittin”

Current weather

Fog and reduced visibility have been reported in parts of Abu Dhabi and other inland areas, prompting caution for drivers and commuters.

Temperatures in cities such as Dubai and Abu Dhabi are dipping into the mid-teens at night — noticeably cooler than recent weeks.



Super ‘ Wolf Moon ’





If you thought the winter breeze was already crisp, it’s time to dig even deeper into your wardrobe. According to the latest forecasts from the National Centre of Meteorology (NCM) and the Emirates Astronomical Society, the UAE is about to enter its most intense cold spell of the year.This period, which runs from January 10 to January 22, is historically recognized as the peak of the winter season, where the mercury takes its most dramatic dip.Experts like Ibrahim Al Jarwan, Chairman of the Emirates Astronomical Society, explain that this isn't just a random weather shift.It is a well-documented phenomenon that combines ancient regional folklore with modern atmospheric science to bring a "real" winter experience to the desert.This upcoming cold spell is tied to a traditional phase known locally as “Der Al Sittin”, a weather pattern embedded in Gulf folklore and long associated with the chilliest days of the year.Der Al Sittin, literally “the sixty days”, is a traditional term used to describe a sustained period of cold weather that has been recognised by locals for generations. Folklore even describes this chill as sharp as a knife’s edge, highlighting just how intense winter mornings can feel during this time.Meteorologists link this period to both solar and atmospheric patterns, including the culmination of the Thuraya (Pleiades) constellation in the evening sky, an event historically connected with winter cold in Arab culture. This mix of cultural wisdom and scientific forecasting gives residents a familiar signal that winter’s peak is near.While daytime temperatures are expected to remain comfortable for most of the UAE, mornings and nights will feel significantly colder, especially before sunrise. Cool breezes and the possibility of frost in open desert regions are likely for those early hours.Before the main cold stretch arrives, weather patterns in the UAE are already showing signs of change:Despite these early signs, forecasters warn that weather predictions become less certain beyond about five days, due to the complexity of atmospheric dynamics. This means residents should keep an eye on regular updates closer to mid-January for the most accurate details.The upcoming cold snap isn't just happening on the ground; it’s being signaled from the stars. This period coincides with the evening culmination of the Thuraya (Pleiades) constellation, a star cluster that has long served as a celestial weather vane for Arab astronomers.When Thuraya reaches its peak in the evening sky, it traditionally signals that the most severe winter conditions have arrived.Adding to the drama of 2026, the first full moon of the year, known as the "Wolf Moon", is set to appear during this cold stretch.This year, it will be a supermoon, meaning the moon will be at its closest point to Earth, appearing unusually large and bright.While the name "Wolf Moon" comes from North American and European folklore, where wolves were said to howl more during the freezing winter nights, it perfectly sets the mood for the UAE’s own chilly January evenings.This winter stretch presents a chance for residents to experience one of the UAE’s traditional weather phases, a period locals have long recognised as the heart of winter. While the cold may be surprising to some, especially those used to milder months, it also offers a reminder of the seasonal rhythms that mark this part of the year in the Gulf region.

The first full moon of the year, known as the "Wolf Moon", is set to appear during this cold stretch.

Article Title: 'A star has been born at SCG': Brilliant Bethell's coming-of-age century draws praise
Article Text:
Jacob Bethell (Getty Images)

Usman Khawaja's retirement speech: 'I want the journey for the next Usman Khawaja to be easier'





Former England cricketer David Gower lavished praise on 22-year-old Jacob Bethell after the England batter struck his maiden First-Class century on Day 4 of the ongoing fifth Ashes Test against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground on Wednesday. Bethell produced a superb unbeaten 142 off 232 balls, laced with 15 fours, to help England build a crucial 119-run lead in their second innings in reply to Australia’s imposing first-innings total of 567."Bethell. Brilliant. Delighted. Nuff said!" Gower wrote on X.Former England captain Michael Vaughan also took to X to applaud Bethell’s technique, adding that the youngster’s innings should serve as a template for England’s Test batters going forward."A star has been born here at the SCG .. The tempo / Technique and class of Jacob Bethell today is the blueprint for England's future Test batters," Vaughan reposted.Bethell then backed up that praise with a flawless maiden Test century, anchoring England’s response as the visitors clawed their way back into the contest and edged into a slender 119-run lead, leaving the fifth and final Ashes Test finely poised. At stumps on Day 4 at the SCG, England were 302 for 8, with Bethell unbeaten on 142 and Matthew Potts yet to score.The left-hander’s knock proved vital after England suffered early setbacks, losing Zak Crawley cheaply and Joe Root soon after. Showing maturity beyond his years, Bethell brought up his hundred in style from 162 deliveries, remaining unfazed as wickets fell around him.Just two overs after Bethell reached three figures, Beau Webster swung the momentum Australia’s way with two wickets in three balls, removing Harry Brook for 42 and dismissing Will Jacks for a duck. England’s woes deepened further when Jamie Smith was run out for 24 following a costly mix-up.Ben Stokes, who had earlier limped off while bowling with what appeared to be a groin issue, came in at No. 7 but lasted only five balls before falling to Webster. England are chasing another morale-boosting victory after their Melbourne triumph, although Australia have already retained the Ashes with a 3-1 series lead.Remarkably, the hundred was Bethell’s first in both Test cricket and red-ball cricket overall, eclipsing his previous best of 96 against New Zealand. Recalled for the Melbourne Test in place of the struggling Ollie Pope, Bethell has further strengthened his hold on the No. 3 spot after also scoring a gritty 40 in difficult conditions.Earlier, Australia were bowled out for 567 before lunch, built around Travis Head’s 163 and a commanding 138 from captain Steve Smith, leaving England to overhaul a daunting first-innings deficit of 183 after being dismissed for 384.England’s reply began on a shaky note as Mitchell Starc struck in the first over, trapping Crawley lbw for one. Ben Duckett, dropped on 38, failed to make the most of the reprieve and was bowled by Michael Neser for 42. Root then endured a torrid stay before falling lbw to Scott Boland for six.Bethell, however, stood firm, taking England past Australia’s lead shortly after tea with a single off Neser and celebrating his hundred with a crisp boundary through midwicket. Webster’s late strikes tilted the momentum back in Australia’s favour, but Bethell’s resolve ensured the contest heads into the final day delicately balanced.
Article Summary: Jacob Bethell hits maiden Test century for England against Australia. Bethell unbeaten on 142 at stumps on Day 4 of fifth Ashes Test at the SCG. Former England captain Michael Vaughan hails Bethell's technique and class. Australia have already retained the Ashes with a 3-1 series lead.

Article Title: What was Bryce Young net worth 2025: $12 Million, and the Panthers already cut the biggest check
Article Text:
Bryce Young’s money story in 2025 starts with a $24.6 million signing bonus and does not stop there. (Image via Getty)

Bryce Young’s Carolina Panthers rookie contract is the real engine of his 2025 money story

Bryce Young’s 2025 earnings were not just “good for a young QB,” they were locked in

Bryce Young’s endorsements were a second paycheck, and he started cashing it before the NFL

Bryce Young’s off-field money also came with a public “grown-up” lane

So, what was Bryce Young’s net worth in 2025?





Bryce Young’s net worth in 2025 was widely estimated at $12 million, with Celebrity Net Worth listed as a primary source for that figure. That number is an estimate. But the money tied to Young’s rookie deal with the Carolina Panthers explains why the estimate keeps landing in the same place across outlets.Young entered the league as the No. 1 overall pick in the 2023 NFL Draft, and his rookie contract looks like what you would expect from that slot. He signed a four-year deal worth $37,955,071, and it came with a $24,603,688 signing bonus.Here is the part people miss when they talk net worth like it is just “salary.” That signing bonus is the heavy lift. It is why Young’s career cash ramped up fast, even though his year-to-year base salaries on a rookie deal are relatively small.By the end of the 2025 season, Over the Cap listed Young’s career earnings at $32,029,381. That is the cleanest public explanation for why a $12 million net worth estimate does not sound wild, even if you treat it as a rough snapshot and not a bank statement.Young’s rookie deal is fully guaranteed per the major contract trackers, and that matters because it removes the “if he sticks” part that usually hovers over early-career money.It also sets up the next step. Young’s contract includes the standard rookie timeline where the big leverage moment is not Year 1. It is the point where the Panthers decide whether he is the long-term plan, and whether he plays himself into extension talks.Young did not wait for Sundays to become a brand. ESPN reported during his Alabama days that he was already approaching major endorsement money, with Nick Saban publicly noting how quickly that side was moving.Once he turned pro, the brand list only got louder. Public reporting has tied Young to deals and partnerships connected to major names like Jordan Brand, Snickers, and BODYARMOR, with multiple outlets covering that early push around the 2023 draft window.Other reporting around Young’s portfolio has included brands such as Bojangles and Lowe’s Home Improvement, which fits the obvious playbook for a Panthers quarterback living in Charlotte, N.C.A lot of players do ads. Fewer build a public identity that is not only product-based. In 2025, local Charlotte reporting spotlighted Young spending an off day talking with teens about mental health at HopeWay.HopeWay also listed an event connected to the Young 9 Foundation, tying the philanthropy side directly to mental wellness fundraising. That kind of visibility does two things at once. It supports the community work, and it keeps Young in the public eye without needing a viral clip or a manufactured headline.Based on widely circulated public estimates, Bryce Young’s net worth in 2025 was $12 million.The better way to frame it is this: the estimate tracks because Young already had (1) a No. 1 pick rookie deal with a massive signing bonus and (2) a real endorsement runway that started before he ever took an NFL snap.
Article Summary: Based on widely circulated public estimates, Bryce Young’s net worth in 2025 was $12 million. The estimate tracks because Young already had (1) a No. 1 pick rookie deal with a massive signing bonus and (2) a real endorsement runway that started before he took an NFL snap.

Article Title: Brett Favre responds after viral post misrepresents his Parkinson’s battle
Article Text:

Brett Favre sets the record straight

How is Brett Favre dealing with Parkinson’s disease

NFL legend Brett Favre has strongly pushed back against a viral social media post that falsely claimed he had “given up hope” while battling Parkinson’s disease. The former quarterback made it clear that while his condition has progressed, he is far from quitting and remains determined to keep fighting.The misleading claim spread rapidly online and reached millions of users, prompting concern among fans. Favre, 56, addressed the issue directly in statements to the media and on social platforms, calling the report completely inaccurate.“I have absolutely not given up and I am fighting till the end,” Favre said on TMZ Sports. “Yes, I have progressed a little faster than I would have hoped, but I’m extremely thankful and blessed.”Favre revealed his Parkinson’s diagnosis publicly in September 2024 during a hearing on Capitol Hill. Since then, he has spoken openly about his health on his podcast, 4th and Favre, discussing both the physical and mental challenges that come with the disease.In recent days, comments from the podcast were taken out of context, leading some social media users to wrongly suggest that Favre had lost hope. The former quarterback said that could not be further from the truth.On social media, Favre thanked fans for their prayers and support while again denying the claim. “Just like I never gave up on the gridiron, I’m not going to start now,” he wrote, adding that he still hopes for better treatments and, one day, a cure.Parkinson’s disease is a progressive neurological condition with no known cure. Favre has explained that he has idiopathic Parkinson’s, the most common form of the illness. He has shared that symptoms such as stiffness, fatigue, and mild shaking are part of his daily routine, especially before medication takes effect.Even with these problems, Favre stays active and involved. He uses his platform to raise awareness about the long-term effects of head injuries and neurological diseases on athletes.Favre's answer shows the same toughness that made him a great player. He was a three-time NFL MVP and a member of the Pro Football Hall of Fame. During his career with the Green Bay Packers and other teams, he became known for being tough.While his post-football life has included controversy and health struggles, Favre’s latest message was focused on clarity and strength. He acknowledged the seriousness of his condition but stressed that realism does not mean surrender.Favre says that for now, he is taking things one day at a time and relying on his family, religion, and medical care. He has a clear and strong message for fans: the struggle is not done.
Article Summary: A viral social media post falsely claimed that Brett Favre had given up on his battle with Parkinson's disease. The former NFL quarterback denied the claim, saying he is still fighting. Favre revealed his Parkinson's diagnosis publicly in September 2024 during a hearing on Capitol Hill.
